result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Mitchell J. Berby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Remain subject to terms and conditions of bond.
Comply with any family court orders and injunctions.
No violent or abusive contact.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell J. Berby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:52 p.m. Defendant Mitchell J. Berby in court with attorney Gerald J. Hersil.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer statement that there are no notes in file - not aware of any violations. Hersil - statement to compliance. State moves to dismiss - Granted. Adj. 3:54 p.m.
DPA
Associated with Charge #3

2:14 p.m. Defendant Mitchell J. Berby in court with attorney Gerald J. Hersil.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm314 and 16cm153. Hersil states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to dismiss but read in Count 1 in 15cm314 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 16cm153 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 3 -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Count 2 will be written DPA. Victim S. F. statement on sentencing. Sowinski/Hersil/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence - Count 3
Jail - 45 days with Huber for all purposes
Fine - $1744, plus blood draw surcharge/IID surcharge/DNA surcharge
Driver's license revocation - 2 years
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA assessment
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).


Court requests written Deferred Prosecution Agreement on Count 2 in 15cm314 be filed. Review hearing on May 8, 2017 at 3:30 p.m. for DPA. 

Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.
Defendant remanded immediately. 
Adj. 2:38 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
